contentrichtext.text: {{redirect|Day planner|the television program|Day Planner}} {{about|the item|the profession|Professional organizing}} {{Expand Japanese|Filofax|date=November 2012}} {{Unreferenced|date=August 2009}} [[File:Agenda.jpg|thumb|Daily Agenda]] A '''personal organizer''', '''day planner''', '''personal analog assistant''', '''personal planner''', '''year planner''', or '''agenda''' (from Latin ''agenda''- things to do), is a small book or binder that is designed to be portable. It usually contains a [[diary (stationery)|diary]], [[calendar]], [[address book]], blank paper, and other sections. A personal organizer may also include pages with useful information, such as maps and telephone codes. It is related to the separate desktop stationery items that have one or more of the same functions, such as appointment calendars, [[rolodex]]es, [[notebook]]s, and [[almanacs]]. By the end of the 20th century, paper-and-binder personal organizers started to be replaced by electronic devices like [[personal digital assistant]]s (PDAs) and [[personal information manager]] software on personal computers. This process has accelerated in the beginning of the 21th century with the advent of [[smartphones]] and [[Tablet computer|tablet computers]]. ==See also== {{commons|Organizer}} *[[Filofax]] *[[Franklin Planner]] *''[[Getting Things Done]]'' *[[Circa Notebook]] *[[Task list]] *[[Time management]] *[[List of personal information managers]] *[[Hipster PDA]] *Day-Timer {{DEFAULTSORT:Personal Organizer}} [[Category:Personal information managers| Personal organizer]] [[Category:Notebooks]]
